metadata.title: How to Use YouTube Clips Feature 2025: Create Shareable Moments
metadata.description: Use YouTube Clips to share video highlights. Let viewers clip and share your content.

hero.headline: How to Use YouTube Clips Feature
hero.subheadline: Let viewers share your best moments. Enable and use Clips.

sections.content: YouTube Clips lets anyone create 5-60 second shareable snippets from your videos—instant word-of-mouth marketing. Viewers clip memorable moments and share them, driving new viewers to your full content. Here's how to enable, use, and maximize this underutilized feature.

sections.title: Enabling Clips
content: Clips are enabled by default for most channels
Toggle 'Allow viewers to clip your content'
You can also enable/disable per video
Live streams eligible after they end

content.title: Share
content.description: Copy link or share to social.

content.title: Always Links Back
content.description: Clips drive traffic to full video.

sections.title: Maximizing Clips
content: Encourage viewers to clip and share
Keep clips enabled unless reason not to
Clip your own content for social media
Short, punchy segments get clipped more
Clips work for marketing your content

faq.question: Do clips hurt my watch time?
faq.answer: No—clips always link back to full video. They drive discovery. A clip is marketing, not a replacement. Viewers often watch clip then full video.

faq.question: Can I disable clips on certain videos?
faq.answer: Yes—per-video setting in video details. Some creators disable for sensitive content or when clips might be taken out of context. Generally keep enabled.

faq.question: How long can clips be?
faq.answer: 5 to 60 seconds. Shorter clips more shareable. Longer clips for context. Sweet spot often 15-30 seconds for social sharing.

faq.question: Do I get revenue from clips?
faq.answer: Not directly from clip views. But clips drive traffic to full video where you do earn. Think of clips as marketing spend that costs nothing.
